posts.name: Tharun
posts.cooked: Hey guys I had a few quick questions about Limelight localization and was wondering if anyone would be able to help. Right now we’re using the megatag 2 example from the limelight documentation and we have success in determine pose when looking at specifically tag number 18 however if we change the tag there is always some offset especially in rotation as the bot does not rotate whatsoever when recalculating the pose with a different tag. We were wondering what things do we tune to make sure that the limelight pose is somewhat correct.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: Can you explain what you mean by switching the tag? Since megatag2 uses the gyro angle, you need to make sure your robot position and angle is always realistic to the tag position.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
Joe_Ross:

megatag2 uses the gyro angle

Gyros drift so make sure you reset it often. Don’t test for an hour and expect the gyro to still be anywhere near the correct value.

posts.name: Alexander Carlisi
posts.cooked:
Make sure you’re calling LimelightHelpers.SetRobotOrientation("limelight", m_poseEstimator.getEstimatedPosition().getRotation().getDegrees(), 0, 0, 0, 0, 0); before getting your pose estimation.

If that’s not the issue, please send a link to your code repo.

posts.name: Tharun
posts.cooked: We switch the tag as in when we deploy our code we’ll put it in front of a tag and sometimes it’ll end up not rotating or sometimes it’ll end up being inside the reef itself.

posts.name: Tharun
posts.cooked: I see I think I might want to check again but im pretty sure that when our robot code our gyro resets itself

posts.name: Tharun
posts.cooked: Yeah I have this running in the periodic method of the drive subsystem. Right now here is the main code that we have in our drive subsystem folder. `public void periodic() { SmartDashboard.putNumber(“Current Bot X position”, m_poseEstimator.getEstimatedPosition().getX()); SmartDashboard.putNumber(“Current Bot Y position”, m_poseEstimator.getEstimatedPosition().getY()); SmartDashboard.putNumber(“Current Bot Angle position”, m_poseEstimator.getEstimatedPosition().getRotation().getDegrees()); SmartDashboard.putNumber(“Motor 1 turning”, front_left.get_position().angle.getDegrees()); SmartDashboard.putNumber(“Motor 2 turning”, front_right.get_position().angle.getDegrees()); SmartDashboard.putNumber(“Motor 3 turning”, back_left.get_position().angle.getDegrees()); SmartDashboard.putNumber(“Motor 4 turning”, back_right.get_position().angle.getDegrees());

posts.name: Alexander Carlisi
posts.cooked:
Your code looks correct, the issue is most likely you not updating your gyro yaw.

If you think about it since tag 18 is considered 0 degrees field centric, when you start your robot code your gyro resets for its starting yaw to be 0 degrees.

So if you put another tag in front of the robot without rotating the gyro properly the Limelight will think it can see the tag from its zero yaw position.

Basically you just need to rotate your robot to the yaw that it should be at, then place the tag in front of it, and it should work.

Hopefully that helps

posts.name: Tharun
posts.cooked: Ah ok that makes so much more sense now. Now that I think about it all the tags that we were testing always were always some horizontal distance away from the tag which assuming that the tag was right infront of the bot with no rotation that would probabely explain why its not rotating. I just wanted to ask a quick followup in that if we were to rotate the bots gyro to the right angle and then put the tag in front of it would we expect to see the right values?

posts.name: Tharun
posts.cooked: Alright thank you so much I will send updates on how it goes later when I get time to test with the bot again.
